description: From Middle English mightles, from Old English mihtlēas, mihtelēas, from Proto-Germanic *mahtilausaz; equivalent to might +‎ -less. Cognate with Scots michtles, Saterland Frisian machtloos, West Frisian machteleas, Dutch machteloos, German Low German machtlos, German machtlos, Swedish maktlös, Icelandic máttlaus.

adjectives.description: mightless (comparative more mightless, superlative most mightless)

entries.meaning: Lacking in might or vigour; powerless; weak.
